definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Do you remember what i wrote on the slate ?
sentences.chinese: 你还记得我在写字板上写的字吗？

sentences.english: The glass holder which can be rotatablely overlapped is arranged in the front end of the tablet.
sentences.chinese: 在写字板的前端，设有可转叠的杯架。

sentences.english: This is the control upon which WordPad application is built.
sentences.chinese: 这是赖以写字板应用程序生成的控制。

sentences.english: I take out a clipboard, write 1 "and how many more than 4?"
sentences.chinese: 我拿出写字板，在上面写了一句“8比4多多少？”

sentences.english: Once WordPad is open, type a string of text into it.
sentences.chinese: 打开“写字板”后，在其中键入一个文本字符串。

sentences.english: Some of tablets appear to be Lexical Lists, written in two or three columns.
sentences.chinese: 其中一些写字板出现了词汇列表，分两至三列写成。

definition: mojibake (nonsense characters displayed when software fails to render text according to its intended character encoding)
Save As ... (menu option in a software application)
shinjitai, simplified Japanese character used since 1946
my (Internet slang variant of 我的[wo3 de5])
